description: Gets information that Amazon CloudWatch Internet Monitor has created and stored about a health event for a specified monitor. This information includes the impacted locations, and all the information related to the event, by location. The information returned includes the impact on performance, availability, and round-trip time, information about the network providers (ASNs), the event type, and so on. Information rolled up at the global traffic level is also returned, including the impact type and total traffic impact.

parameters.name: EventId
parameters.description: The internally-generated identifier of a health event. Because EventID contains the forward slash ('/') character, you must URL-encode the EventID field in the request URL.

nested_items.name: EventArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the event.

nested_items.name: EventId
nested_items.description: The internally-generated identifier of a health event.

nested_items.name: StartedAt
nested_items.description: The time when a health event started.

nested_items.name: EndedAt
nested_items.description: The time when a health event was resolved. If the health event is still active, the end time is not set.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The time when a health event was created.

nested_items.name: LastUpdatedAt
nested_items.description: The time when a health event was last updated or recalculated.

nested_items.name: ImpactedLocations
nested_items.description: The locations affected by a health event.

nested_items.name: ASName
nested_items.description: The name of the internet service provider (ISP) or network (ASN).

nested_items.name: ASNumber
nested_items.description: The Autonomous System Number (ASN) of the network at an impacted location.

nested_items.name: Country
nested_items.description: The name of the country where the health event is located.

nested_items.name: Subdivision
nested_items.description: The subdivision location where the health event is located. The subdivision usually maps to states in most countries (including the United States). For United Kingdom, it maps to a country (England, Scotland, Wales) or province (Northern Ireland).

nested_items.name: Metro
nested_items.description: The metro area where the health event is located.

nested_items.name: City
nested_items.description: The name of the city where the health event is located.

nested_items.name: Latitude
nested_items.description: The latitude where the health event is located.

nested_items.name: Longitude
nested_items.description: The longitude where the health event is located.

nested_items.name: CountryCode
nested_items.description: The country code where the health event is located. The ISO 3166-2 codes for the country is provided, when available.

nested_items.name: SubdivisionCode
nested_items.description: The subdivision code where the health event is located. The ISO 3166-2 codes for country subdivisions is provided, when available.

nested_items.name: ServiceLocation
nested_items.description: The service location where the health event is located.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the health event at an impacted location.

nested_items.name: Networks
nested_items.description: The networks that could be impacted by a network impairment event.

nested_items.name: ASName
nested_items.description: The name of the internet service provider (ISP) or network (ASN).

nested_items.name: ASNumber
nested_items.description: The Autonomous System Number (ASN) of the internet provider or network.

nested_items.name: AsPath
nested_items.description: The combination of the Autonomous System Number (ASN) of the network and the name of the network.

nested_items.name: ASName
nested_items.description: The name of the internet service provider (ISP) or network (ASN).

nested_items.name: ASNumber
nested_items.description: The Autonomous System Number (ASN) of the internet provider or network.

nested_items.name: NetworkEventType
nested_items.description: The type of network impairment.

nested_items.name: InternetHealth
nested_items.description: The calculated health at a specific location.

nested_items.name: Availability
nested_items.description: Availability in Internet Monitor represents the estimated percentage of traffic that is not seeing an availability drop. For example, an availability score of 99% for an end user and service location pair is equivalent to 1% of the traffic experiencing an availability drop for that pair.

nested_items.name: ExperienceScore
nested_items.description: Experience scores, or health scores are calculated for different geographic and network provider combinations (that is, different granularities) and also summed into global scores. If you view performance or availability scores without filtering for any specific geography or service provider, Amazon CloudWatch Internet Monitor provides global health scores.

nested_items.name: PercentOfTotalTrafficImpacted
nested_items.description: The impact on total traffic that a health event has, in increased latency or reduced availability. This is the percentage of how much latency has increased or availability has decreased during the event, compared to what is typical for traffic from this client location to the Amazon Web Services location using this client network.

nested_items.name: PercentOfClientLocationImpacted
nested_items.description: The percentage of impact caused by a health event for client location traffic globally.

nested_items.name: Performance
nested_items.description: Performance in Internet Monitor represents the estimated percentage of traffic that is not seeing a performance drop. For example, a performance score of 99% for an end user and service location pair is equivalent to 1% of the traffic experiencing a performance drop for that pair.

nested_items.name: ExperienceScore
nested_items.description: Experience scores, or health scores, are calculated for different geographic and network provider combinations (that is, different granularities) and also totaled into global scores. If you view performance or availability scores without filtering for any specific geography or service provider, Amazon CloudWatch Internet Monitor provides global health scores.

nested_items.name: PercentOfTotalTrafficImpacted
nested_items.description: The impact on total traffic that a health event has, in increased latency or reduced availability. This is the percentage of how much latency has increased or availability has decreased during the event, compared to what is typical for traffic from this client location to the Amazon Web Services location using this client network.

nested_items.name: PercentOfClientLocationImpacted
nested_items.description: How much performance impact was caused by a health event at a client location. For performance, this is the percentage of how much latency increased during the event compared to typical performance for traffic, from this client location to an Amazon Web Services location, using a specific client network.

nested_items.name: RoundTripTime
nested_items.description: This is the percentage of how much round-trip time increased during the event compared to typical round-trip time for your application for traffic.

nested_items.name: P50
nested_items.description: RTT at the 50th percentile (p50).

nested_items.name: P90
nested_items.description: RTT at the 90th percentile (p90).

nested_items.name: P95
nested_items.description: RTT at the 95th percentile (p95).

nested_items.name: Ipv4Prefixes
nested_items.description: The IPv4 prefixes at the client location that was impacted by the health event.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of a health event.

nested_items.name: PercentOfTotalTrafficImpacted
nested_items.description: The impact on total traffic that a health event has, in increased latency or reduced availability. This is the percentage of how much latency has increased or availability has decreased during the event, compared to what is typical for traffic from this client location to the Amazon Web Services location using this client network.

nested_items.name: ImpactType
nested_items.description: The type of impairment of a specific health event.

nested_items.name: HealthScoreThreshold
nested_items.description: The threshold percentage for a health score that determines, along with other configuration information, when Internet Monitor creates a health event when there's an internet issue that affects your application end users.
